runs.comm: on the pads, worked square. He's off the mark with a couple
clipped off the toes once again, Sidebottom's line is slightly off so far, and Collingwood removes a slip as a result
better line but a similar result. Midwicket tidies up as Smith is kept to a single this time
full and threatening to bend back into the right-hander. Punched to mid-on
outside off, no contact there. That's a better line and length
bending towards off stump having initially angled across the right-hander. A good recovery after a loose start to the over
full and tight outside off. Smith looks back in some alarm as the ball starts to roll back towards his stumps, but it's safe
nudged into the gully where Morgan pounces with intent.
turned inside-out as he seeks to work off the hip. Probing stuff so far
right up to the bat from over the wicket. Defended resolutely on off stump
slower delivery, looped onto a good length, nurdled to deep midwicket
driven, loosely, and short cover is almost in business. Kallis just eludes the fielder, but that's a tidy first over from Bresnan
that's the way to do it! Just back of a length, and helped dismissively over the midwicket fence! Top shot
dabbed to backward point, a direct hit would have been close, but Morgan's shy fizzes past the stumps
Smith makes room late, Broad follows him, and Kieswetter scrambles to cut off the four byes
swatted up and over midwicket, not quite such good contact this time, but more runs to the cause
Smith advances again, and Broad follows him again. Well watched, as he thumps the pad way down the leg side
cracking finish, a loopy slower ball, and that hops over the stumps as Smith swings at thin air. He pulled that over back well after the first-ball six
full and straight, little to work with
steps inside the line, but Bresnan refuses to be cowed. Full again
attacking the stumps again, with a slight change of pace. Canny bowling
slower-ball bouncer, and Kallis is struck in the ribs as he mistimes his pull
good again, on the spot, and excellent fielding off his own bowling to save the single
fired into the blockhole, punched to cover. Fine over
that's the wicket, and you have to say it was coming. England have kept the pressure on in the Powerplay, Broad pitched it up, and Pietersen at mid-on pouched a simple lofted drive
outside off, left alone watchfully as Gibbs gauges the pace
extra nip from a good length, Gibbs sizes up a pull, but can't make contact
full and straight - a very different approach from England today, after their short-pitched barrage against Pakistan. Gibbs deflects to fine leg
waist-high full-toss, and a front-foot overstep as well. Rubbish on all fronts from Broad, and a free hit coming up
slogged across the line, a slow full toss. Not clever bowling, and that's gone through square leg for four
back on a better line and length, defended back down the pitch
too short, and Gibbs doesn't waste that. A cross-batted flog through midwicket, and that beats the field
onto the back foot, pushed into the covers
slower ball once again, Smith waits and waits, and eases a slog-pull into the leg side
patted out to deep cover
cracked fiercely back down the track, but Bresnan half-stops that in his followthrough. Good commitment to save a run
offcutter to finish, Gibbs rides the bounce to work a single down to third man. Singles galore

gone! Yardy strikes first-ball, but that owed everything to Ryan Sidebottom's salmon-like leap at short fine leg. A skied slog, spiralling off a leading edge, and a superbly judged take, running back and across
round the wicket, looped into the blockhole, patted to mid-on
loose from Yardy, smart work from Kieswetter, as that is fired flat down the leg-side
chipped to midwicket, and picked up on the toes
shovelled out to deep square leg, South Africa are struggling to lift their momentum right now
drifting a touch down the leg-side, a big sweep, an under-edge, and Sidebottom can't cut that off at fine leg
a massive appeal from Swann as Smith has a wipe across the line. The ball strikes those "massive" pads, and that's probably reasonably close
another appeal, more vociferous, but less convincing
gone! And Smith was always on the back foot in that little duel. A lofted slog-sweep, and that's catching practice on the midwicket boundary
into position for the Dilscoop, but that is called leg-byes as short fine leg tidies up
round the wicket, looped onto a good length, defended solidly
two steps down the track, and a firm clunk to long-on
that's a massive wicket! Outside off, tossed up, and a touch of turn is enough to beat the outside edge of the bat, but clip the top of off stump!
turning down the leg side. Kieswetter gathers well
nurdled to square leg
tossed up from round the wicket, punched down to long-on
tucked to midwicket, and South Africa are looking baffled at present.
nudged out to midwicket. Singles are as good as it gets at the moment, and the run-rate is starting to escalate
down the track, flicked to midwicket, another single
magnificent fielding from Collingwood at short mid-on. One-handed snaffle to intercept the clipped drive, and cut off the single
loopy delivery, and no contact there
slightly short, but arrow-straight. Biffed out to deep cover and cut off with a sliding stop
this is now officially a procession. A loose mow across the line, a big top-edge, and Paul Collingwood steadies himself at midwicket to pouch the chance
patted into the deep, and it's all the fives with ten overs to go
great work again from Collingwood, intercepting a punched drive at short cover to limit Boucher to a single
that's what South Africa need! A shimmy down the track, a full swing of the bat, and that lands ten rows back, near a big fellow in a stripey blue shirt
tapped into the gap to rotate the strike
clipped off the toes to deep midwicket
back into the crease, and forced down to long-on, as Yardy tries to intercept but dives into the non-striker instead
wafted off the hip, singles aren't enough from this position
tapped to point
tossed up outside off, but too far outside off
flicked square for another single
whipped around the corner. Tidy stuff from Swann
loopy line and length. Boucher can do no more than defend
back into the crease, and defended into the gap
worked off the hip, and that's another superb over in the circumstances. Every single is a job done from here for England
loose from Yardy, fired down the leg side
pumped down to wide long-on, but intercepted
a valuable boundary, for net run-rate if nothing else. Down the leg-side, and helped on its way
tucked to square leg
missed stumping, and a dropped catch. Kieswetter won't like that, reprieving his opposite number. Down the track, a thin snick, and either mode of dismissal would have done
flicked out to the deep, and that delivery at least keeps up with the required rate
now then, is this the start of the charge? Down the track, belted high and handsomely over the bowler's head, and that's put the pressure on the bowler a touch
good riposte, tossed up and deflected for a single
that could be curtains. Boucher attempted to match Duminy's blow, but the ball got caught in the crosswind, and Eoin Morgan at cow corner was in place for a simple take
tried to push for two, but nothing doing there
looped up outside off, and snaffled at short midwicket
swept firmly but only as far as the sweeper at deep midwicket
bunted out to midwicket, no elevation on the stroke though
back and across, sizing up the cut but picking out gully
down the track, but met by a leaping delivery that seemed to rear off the back of the bat and into the visor. Sidebottom races the non-striker, but can't quite get the boot in on a run-out chance
short, but slow. A controlled pull rolls out to deep square leg
pulled again, but not timed. Another slow bouncer
another slower bouncer. A fair distance outside off, but Sidebottom gets away with the wide. Kieswetter struggles to gather and they pinch a single
maybe they aren't dead yet! A clever up-and-over pull, and the ball plops over fine leg for a one-bounce four!
massive appeal for lbw, and Broad is aghast as the ball deflects down to third man. But that was missing off
better length, clipped to midwicket, a race to get back for the second but that's comfortably home
clipped to deep midwicket, and a sturdy shy keeps them to one
flicked pull, not a lot of contact.  None off the bat, in fact
biffed out to midwicket. Another single, and another hike in the run-rate. It's pushing 15 now
another slow bouncer, about the sixth in a row from Sidebottom, and that's a limp swat, straight to short backward square!
flashed up and over the covers, the man on the rope races in but can't quite make up the ground
bosh. That's vast. In the slot, and smacked over long-on. That's travelled way back into the stands
outside off, swinging away, and Botha can't make contact with an attempted dab
battered on the up, but Pietersen on the boundary's edge dares them to go for the second, and they wisely decide not to try
Swann at third man tidies up expertly as the ball rushes across the turf
tucked off the toes, and Sidebottom's arm is too good to allow a second run
down the leg-side, but that cannons off the pads and away to square leg
banged in short, too short
another bouncer, and this one follows Steyn as he advances down the track
a swing and a miss, and it's three a ball now
short, smacked, caught. Elementary dismissal as Morgan charges in from the midwicket rope, and another one takes the long walk
biffed away for Botha to retain the strike
wow, Sidebottom clings onto a blinder! That was smashed straight back towards his kneecaps, and it was self-preservation that made that take possible
tapped into the covers
low full-toss, outside off, tapped to midwicket
right up in the blockhole, and Sidebottom leaps to his right to prevent the single
crunched into the covers, but the placement is awry
all over red rover. A low full-toss, and that's good enough as Morkel misses and the timbers are rattled!
